list.item: Arrive Sydney a little early about 8 pm, and spot in rapid succession Alan M and Dave N. Mutual introductions, and we drive off to Sancta Sophia. Walk down to pub for a pint or so before collapsing.
TEI/Master Workshop: could have been worse

In the evening, Peter insists on taking us on ferry boat to ?, where we meet his mum, and proceed to a posh resto by the now invisibly dark seaside; a bit too pretentious for matty; he and i argue spiritedly about page images stoutly ignoring peter's mum and her aged friend, who therefore have to focus on creagh. i am falling asleep and want to get home to panic about my talks long before the taxi finally appears

item.p: I give two plenaries, one at the start of the day and one after lunch about the BNC: both brilliant

Afterwards, join D Pitti et al people for drinks in the Nags Head, followed by conf dinner in Indian resto on Glebe Pt Rd: heated argument on immigration issues with Ian Johnson, his charming oriental wife, and Peter R. More interesting than the Burrowses anyway.

list.item: Last day of conf; I have to move rooms again, up to rm 215 on top corridor. Everyone goes to dine at Toren's house except me

Wake late, shower in solitary splendour, wonder how I will find anyone to play with, and then Matthew and A-M turn up and we agree to meet later for tourism purposes. I have time to walk down Church St to King St to get my haircut before meeting then again for expedition to the Botanic Gdns (excellent lunch in posh resto; flying foxes; ) and ferry trip to Manly (a bit too late to do much but walk a little along the cliff). We drink a lot of wine in winebar on Glebe Pt Rd (Matthew insists on sending one bottle back) and then eat in very noisy thai restaurant, where the proprietor and A-M strike up friendship on basis of shared love for scandinavian furniture. Back home, I find secret instructiomns for how to get into my new luxury apt, and do so: goodness me, what a lot of space and gadgetry!

Wake too late to find anyone much, though I just miss both Matty and Alan, and leave notes for both before returning to enjoy my splendour, shop for breakfast items, do washing etc. Around lunchtime, call David. Fail to connect my machine to the net in his office, but check email anyway.
Public holiday. To Bondi Beach! To Chinatown, where we saw a dragon and bought opals. Was this the day we had delicious chinese vegeterian?

item.p: Dave rings to say he thinks the weather's too bad for an outing, but evidence doesnt support this, especially when he's finished whatever the lecture preparation panic was about. So we set off around midday, and drive down the Gt West Rd, to various scenic mountain spots: Wentworth Falls, and then Katoomba where we had steak and chips in beautifully preserved 20s restaurant, aptly named The Paragon. We do vertical mtn railway and swiss cable car along with many other japanese tourists, nice rainforest though. Back to the car just as the skies open and the thunder storm begins.
In the evening, we drive to the Rocks, through the rain, interesting inner city urban renewal kind of thing, and a pub selling nice beer.

Got up, tidied up, reluctant to leave my palatial flat, but did so anyway. After 1000 re-negotiated a checkout time of 11 with the Lancashire lass at reception, and almost made it. Walk across greens and the campus, dragging my stuffed suitcase to David's office. Kids are back, students everywhere. Had a coffee with David, checked my email, used the loo, left all the stuff with him and departed c. 1400 for Circular Harbour again

Took Ferry to Manly again: this time, packed with holiday makers, mostly Oz or Japanese. Harbour views magnificent, sunshine beautiful. Arriving at Manly, walk across to the Beach proper, along street just like imagined English seaside town, and buy fish and chips to eat on the beach. Sun a bit sporadic, but enough of it to warrant sitting down doing nowt for half an hour or so; watch surfers in wet suits doing implausible things on top of waves, wonder whether or not to do more scenic walking, but not really enough time. Back on 1635 ferry, and then catch tube train to Newtown, wrong end of Kings road for David's flat, where he is packing.
We get falafel sandwiches from the habibi, and wash it down with properly made and served delicious oolong tea, as per David's instructions from Meili. And then we get cab to the train for Melbourne.

list.item: Woken from fitful slumbers on lurching train by disgusting apology for breakfast. Never mind, we are now in Melbourne. Dave takes me on rapid tram-based tour for an hour or so, and we get some coffee, before I take next train off to Castlemaine. His mate that he's going to stay with has announced that Janine will be there too, which throws Dave somewhat. My train rattles slowly through the bush as I type the day's events. Jan meets me off the train. Meet Bernie, who's on night shift, and his bees; also 2 dogs, 2 cats, 5 ducks, and a sheep. In the evening, attend Jan's rehearsal and slope off to pub across the road.

Potter about in the morning. I could get to like this place: walk into Maldon for coffee. Home made pizza-like thing for lunch. Jan drives me to Melbourne again, where we eventually find resto. Strange dinner with their mum, (my long lost aunty Etty), Dave's asstd chums, Eva and Swedish husband. Jan and Dave take me back to airport in good time for return to business class space and time: flight is full, unfortunately, but I manage to sleep a bit. And so eventually, back to Bangkok airport where I have a trouser disaster.
